Diagnosis.
Description.

Holotype female.
Length: Body 6.5 mm; forewing 5.7 mm. Head 1.3 x as broad as long. MID 0.55 x head width. UID:MID:LID = 7.4:10:8.0. POL:OOL = 1: 0.62. Clypeus 2.4 x as broad as long. Gena, in profile, 0.2 x eye width. Scape:Fl1:Fl2 = 7.6:10:8.9; Fl1 3.7 x as long as thick, 0.86 x as long as UID. Longer spur of hind tibia 0.69 x hind tarsomere 1. FW marginal cell removed from wing tip by 0.47 x its own length. SMC2:SMC3 = 1:1.5 on vein M , 1:0.43 on vein Rs. SMC2 narrowed on vein Rs by 1.0 x its length on vein M , receiving crossvein 1m-cu at basal 0.57. SMC3 narrowed on vein Rs by 0.29 x its length on vein M , receiving crossvein 2m-cu at basal 0.45, removed from outer wing margin by 1.5 x its own length.

Pubescence on body and legs mostly silvery, but that on following sericeous: upper frons, vertex, mesosoma dorsally (except for propodeum posteriorly), upper meso- and metapleura, metasomal terga anteriorly and posteriorly, metasomal sterna posteriorly, fore tibia and tarsus, and mid and hind tarsi.

Head 1.3-1.4 (1.3) x as broad as long. Vertex not convex between eye tops (Fig. 1A ). Frons in lateral view gently convex (Fig. 1K ), with frontal line very fine on lower half, almost obsolete on upper half. Antennocular line slightly inclined from antennal base toward eye (Fig. 1B ). MID 0.52-0.56 (0.55) x head width. UID:MID:LID = 7.2-7.8 (7.4):10:7.9-8.6 (8.0). POL:OOL = 1:0.50-0.67 (0.62). Clypeus 2.4-2.7 (2.4) x as broad as long; apical margin almost transversely straight (Fig. 1A ). Labrum with apical margin almost transversely straight medially. Gena, in profile, 0.1-0.2 (0.2) x eye width. Scape:Fl1:Fl2 = 7.1-8.2 (7.6):10:8.2-9.2 (8.9); Fl1 3.7-4.5 (3.7) x as long as thick, 0.83-0.98 (0.86) x as long as UID.

Mid tibia with five to eight spines externally and two or three spines internally. Hind tibia with six to eight spines externally and five to seven spines internally. Longer spur of hind tibia 0.63-0.71 (0.69) x hind tarsomere 1.

FW and HW as shown in Fig. 1H . Marginal cell removed from wing tip by 0.42-0.49 (0.47) x its own length. SMC2:SMC3 = 1:1.3-1.6 (1.5) on vein M , 1:0.36-0.62 (0.43) on vein Rs. SMC2 narrowed on vein Rs by 0.83-1.1 (1.0) x its length on vein M , receiving crossvein 1m-cu at basal 0.48-0.60 (0.57). SMC3 narrowed on vein Rs by 0.25-0.35 (0.29) x its length on vein M , receiving crossvein 2m-cu at basal 0.44-0.59 (0.45), removed from outer wing margin by 1.2-1.7 (1.5) x its own length. Crossvein cu-a perpendicular to vein A .

Head 1.3 x as broad as long. Vertex, in frontal view, raised in ocellar area above level of eye tops (Fig. 2A ). MID 0.57-0.63 x head width. UID:MID:LID = 7.9-8.4:10:7.7-8.1. POL:OOL = 1:0.56-0.69. Clypeus 2.4-2.7 x as broad as long, narrower than LID (Fig. 2A ). Gena, in dorsal view, slightly thicker than in female (Fig. 2B ), 0.2-0.3 x eye width in profile. Scape:Fl1:Fl2 = 8.0-8.5:10:9.8-10; Fl1 3.0-3.5 x as long as thick, 0.60-0.70 x as long as UID.

Mid tibia with five or six spines externally and two or three short spines internally. Hind tibia with five to eight spines externally and four or five spines internally. Longer spur of hind tibia 0.65-0.83 x hind tarsomere 1.

Fore and hind wings as shown in Fig. 2D . Marginal cell removed from wing tip by 0.36-0.44 x its own length. SMC2:SMC3 = 1:1.2-1.5 on vein M , 1:0.41-0.74 on vein Rs. SMC2 narrowed on vein Rs by 0.90-1.1 x its length on vein M , receiving crossvein 1m-cu at basal 0.36-0.57. SMC3 narrowed on vein Rs by 0.29-0.45 x its length on vein M , receiving crossvein 2m-cu at basal 0.45-0.55, removed from outer wing margin by 1.3-1.8 x its own length.
Etymology.
The species name is derived from its locality, i.e., Malaysia.
